title: Conversations on Electricity Affordability
summary: An afternoon of insights from clean energy experts hosted by Canary Media and Resources for the Future. America has an electricity affordability problem. Sapna Gheewala-Dowla, Associate Vice President of Policy and Research, Alliance to Save Energy Charles Hua, Founder and Executive Director, Powerlines Julian Spector, Senior Reporter, Canary Media (Moderator) 2:30 – 4:00pm Electricity Affordability Panel, moderated by Julian Spector, Canary Media Limited street parking is available. Our mission is to improve environmental, energy, and natural resource decisions through impartial economic research and policy engagement.

title: Canary Live Washington D.C.
summary: Previously, he covered climate change and clean energy for five years at Vox and 10 years at Grist. She has been a reporter for more than 30 years, half of them covering climate change. Justin Worland is a senior correspondent at TIME covering energy and climate change. In 2022, Worland was named the inaugural Climate Journalist of the Year by Covering Climate Now for his coverage of complex climate issues.

title: Navigating the Shifting Solar Landscape: Supply, Technology, and Policy Insights for 2025
summary: Action is the latest in six months of efforts to address the supply-demand imbalance Download the free report sample of CEA’s PV Supply, Technology, and Policy Report (STPR) for Q1 2025 by completing the form on the right. The PV Supply, Technology, and Policy Report (STPR) is published on a quarterly basis and covers global and regional supply chain analysis, technology trends, and regional policy analysis. Given the breadth of technological developments in PV, there will be a new technology focus each quarter.
